reviews.text: I had to be in Tulsa overnight and this was close to the location where I was going. Check was quick and smooth. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Suite was nicely laid out, Bed was comfortable. Plenty of room. Huge TV, good computer work area. All in all, a nice stay. It is next to a busy highway and in the flight path of the Tulsa International Airport but still noise was at a minimum. Good breakfast as well.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights. My first night, while on my computer in the lobby, the manager started yelling at one of her employees in front of many guests. And it didn't end. It seems that the lady has issues. Deep issues. She yelled to three employees at the lobby making a scene. A guest who asked about pets being allowed at the hotel was also yelled at by this manager. I don't know how can someone manage a hotel and have that attitude with staff and guests. Very unprofessional. I work for a magazine in New York City, have stayed in several hotels, and I have never seen a manager treat her employees and guest that way. Hotel with great staff but bad bad manager.
reviews.title: Awful hotel manager

reviews.text: Next day while at the bar in the lobby, the manager again, yelled and was emotionally abusive to one of the front desk agents. Me and my friends went to the girl at the front desk and told her that she was doing a good job.
reviews.title: Value built in.

reviews.text: I am never staying here again.
reviews.title: Convenience, Amenities and Ambiance

reviews.text: I chose this hotel because of it's close proximity to St. Fancis Hospital. I arrived early and the clerk found a room for me within just a few moments while I enjoyed a little lunch at the cafe'/bar located in the lobby. My room was well appointed with a large flat screen TV, large sofa, desk and wet bar with a fridge. The bed was comfortable and the room was very clean. The staff from the maid service to the front desk was friendly, courteous and seemed to genuinely care about my needs. The morning breakfast service was outstanding including the usual cereal and oats but also included freshly made breakfast sandwiches, french toast, juices and Starbucks coffee. All in all my experience here was outstanding. My only negative point was the A/C unit in my room is just next to the bed and was a bit noisey.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I traveled to Tulsa for the weekend with my girlfriend and wanted an upscale place to stay at an affordable price. The Hyatt Place was a great combination of the two-- the rooms were quite large and well furnished, the facilities were newly renovated and the included morning breakfast buffet was above average. There was also free wifi internet, which costs extra at most luxury hotels. To top it off, the price couldn't be beat; I paid $81 for one night on a Saturday, which was among the cheaper rates I found when researching hotels for that night.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay, great value, one minor drawback

reviews.text: The hotel is about a 15 minute drive from downtown, but there are a lot of restaurants and stores nearby so you don't feel like you're out in the boonies. The surrounding area is actually very scenic with rolling hills and upscale subdivisions.
reviews.title: Maybe not next time

reviews.text: The only drawback was that the housekeeping staff was a little loud in the morning and could be heard in the hallway outside our room talking loudly. To be fair, though, it wasn't until around 9 am that we heard any noise.
reviews.title: Wonderful value

reviews.text: Overall the hotel was comfortable, the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, and the included freebies were a great perk. I highly recommend.
reviews.title: No government / military rates

reviews.text: I will probably pass on this hotel next time. I like staying at Hyatt Place because it affords extra room for a reasonable price. However, if you are wanting a room that allows you to stay connected to the Internet you will be disappointed. The Internet in our room was very very slow. The good news is that they do have two computers downstairs but that is a disappointing
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: Great hotel for one night while traveling cross country. The hotel is essentially new, and in a nicer part of town, but only 5 minutes off the highway. The rooms were very nice, and the furniture was comfortable, especially the bed. We finally got a good nights sleep!
reviews.title: Comfy beds, great decor, many restaurants nearby

reviews.text: There are many restaurants nearby, and we walked over to the Charleston's and had a hearty meal. It has all the amenities, such as pool and gym. The free breakfast was definitely a couple notches above all the other breakfasts we had along the way, with a gourmet flair including a high end egg McMuffin with pancetta (?) instead of bacon.
reviews.title: All you could want at a good price

reviews.text: We will stay here again on our return trip.
reviews.title: Clean and new, but not long term stay or business tech user friendly.

reviews.text: We stayed a the Hyatt Place in Tulsa. It is an all suite hotel that was very clean well located and pleasant. It is not fancy however, it has clean suite rooms great beds, large TV and and amiable staff. Great for the price.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!

reviews.text: "There is a laundromat about a mile away, we don't have those here."
reviews.title: 3:00AM Phone Scam

reviews.text: We stayed her on a Saturday Night and again, later in our trip, on the following Tuesday and Wednesday Nights. Convenient location to most anything in Tulsa. Surprises: We found a 24hour CVS less than a block away. Nice restaurants which were just as close. On Saturday night we went to Charleston's, a regional chain not in our part of the country. Impressive.
reviews.title: Exceptional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The two of us have stayed at other similar hotels, Embassy Suites, Homewood Suites, but this hotel is at the top of our list for excellence.
reviews.title: Weekend Away

reviews.text: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Place. The staff was very friendly, the room was clean and comfortable. Definitely suited for business travel, but we enjoyed the space design. Decent in-room coffee and a mini-fridge. The room was spotless, the bed very comfortable. The breakfast was good/standard fare. But really good (Starbucks) coffee. We could even get a beer or drink at the small bar area. The hotel was a very good value for price, quality of amenities and location.
reviews.title: Still a great hotel

reviews.text: Just stayed at the Hyatt Place and they continue to impress me with their service and the overall cleanliness and value of the hotel. The "warm" breakfast they now have just added more value to the stay.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is close to a ton of restaurants, shopping, etc. on 71st street. The bedding isn't as good as Hilton Garden Inn (the Hilton property which I would compare to the Hyatt Place hotels) but decent enough. I had a couple of their "in-house" meals for dinner and they were very good.
reviews.title: Big room, but smaller can be better
